intro: Picea abies var. nigra, commonly known as the black spruce, is a subspecies of the Norway spruce native to northern Europe and parts of Russia. It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its dark, almost black bark and conical shape. The leaves are needle-like, typically dark green, and arranged in crossed pairs on the shoots. It thrives in cold, moist environments and is often found in boreal forests. The cones are small and woody, containing seeds that are dispersed by wind.
